original_solution_mapping.L1: Luke started putting together, 1000 x 0.1 = <<1000*0.1=100>>100 pieces.
original_solution_mapping.L2: The next day, there were 1000-100 = <<1000-100=900>>900 pieces left.
original_solution_mapping.L3: Then he put together 900 * 0.2 = <<900*0.2=180>>180 pieces on the second day.
original_solution_mapping.L5: On the third day, he put together 720 * 0.3 = <<720*0.3=216>>216 pieces.
original_solution_mapping.L6: Therefore, Luke still has 720 - 216 = <<720-216=504>>504 pieces left to complete the puzzle.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 6991.
    Returns: the number of pieces left to complete the puzzle.
    """
    # L1
    total_pieces = 1000 # 1000-piece jigsaw puzzle
    first_day_percent = 0.1 # 10% of the pieces
    pieces_first_day = total_pieces * first_day_percent

    # L2
    pieces_remaining_after_first_day = total_pieces - pieces_first_day

    # L3
    second_day_percent = 0.2 # another 20% of the remaining pieces
    pieces_second_day = pieces_remaining_after_first_day * second_day_percent

    # L4
    pieces_remaining_after_second_day = pieces_remaining_after_first_day - pieces_second_day

    # L5
    third_day_percent = 0.3 # 30% of the remaining pieces
    pieces_third_day = pieces_remaining_after_second_day * third_day_percent

    # L6
    pieces_left_final = pieces_remaining_after_second_day - pieces_third_day

    # FA
    answer = pieces_left_final
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Luke started putting together, {total_pieces} x {first_day_percent} = <<{total_pieces}*{first_day_percent}={pieces_first_day}>>{pieces_first_day} pieces.
The next day, there were {total_pieces}-{pieces_first_day} = <<{total_pieces}-{pieces_first_day}={pieces_remaining_after_first_day}>>{pieces_remaining_after_first_day} pieces left.

Then he put together {pieces_remaining_after_first_day} * {second_day_percent} = <<{pieces_remaining_after_first_day}*{second_day_percent}={pieces_second_day}>>{pieces_second_day} pieces on the second day.
On the third day, he put together {pieces_remaining_after_second_day} * {third_day_percent} = <<{pieces_remaining_after_second_day}*{third_day_percent}={pieces_third_day}>>{pieces_third_day} pieces.

Therefore, Luke still has {pieces_remaining_after_second_day} - {pieces_third_day} = <<{pieces_remaining_after_second_day}-{pieces_third_day}={pieces_left_final}>>{pieces_left_final} pieces left to complete the puzzle.
